"Some have complained that Here Lies Love glamorizes the Marcoses, an argument that is hard to credit, especially when their crimes pile up during the show's second half. With a narrative that mirrors bad fiction and a leading lady who so fully embraces her own vulgarity, what are writers to do? More to the point, a show that once came across as an amusingly lurid piece of 1980s history now seems unnervingly predictive of our own modern-day politics, with its stripper lawsuits and rape trials, its insurrections and paranoia, all fueled by a cascade of lies."
